entry.content:
`webnn::coreml::GraphBuilder::CreateAndBuild` is only expected to get

called on validated graphs and doesn't further validate. So the fuzzer

should only test this on valid graphs.

entry.title: arc: Return immediately after dispatching a scroll event
entry.content:
Dispatching a scroll event to a widget might cause a close event

and the notification view gets deleted.

It's safer to return immediately after dispatching a scroll event

as the following code is not needed for handling a scroll event.

entry.content:

run with the new zaura_output_manager_v2 protocol.

to hook into metrics / destruction.

entry.title: [ozone] Add zaura_output_manager_v2 client side impl
entry.content:
This CL introduces WaylandZAuraOutputManagerV2, serving as the

client-side handle for the zaura_output_manager_v2 global.



This class handles output configuration change events, communicated

to clients via the following events.

wl_registry.global - output adds

wl_registry.global_remove - output removes

zaura_output_manager_v2.* - output changes

zaura_output_manager_v2.done - transaction complete



This global must be advertised by the server before other output

globals. If this is bound clients will skip binding to older

output extensions (zaura_outut_manager, zxdg_output_manager_v1).



The zaura_output_manager_v2 global is enabled for ozone tests

generally under the AuraOutputManagerProtocol::kEnabledV2 enum.



TestZAuraOutputManagerV2 has been introduced to integrate the

protocol with the ozone/wayland test suites, enabled under the

AuraOutputManagerProtocol::kEnabledV2 enum flag.



Bug: 40063732, 40062713, 41491312, 324111902

Change-Id: Ib29580ab6ca5a8eeae3efce829b9ee8fd47ec5da

entry.title: sensors: Only skip Sensor::Deactivate() from ContextDestroyed() if idle
entry.content:
The code also skipped Deactivate() if |pending_error_notification_| was

active, but there is a short window during which ContextDestroyed() may

be called between HandleError() and NotifyError() that would cause the

latter to hit its DCHECK for |state_|.



Relax the ContextDestroyed() check so that Deactivate() is skipped only

if |state_| is idle.

entry.title: [Autofill] Convert all full server cards to masked cards
entry.content:
Full server cards (that is, server cards whose full number has

been stored locally in the AutofillTable) were deprecated in early

2020. At that time, it stopped being possible to *add* a new full

server card, but existing cards were kept.



This change removes full server cards entirely. This is done by

dropping the unmasked_credit_cards table. Doing so causes those

cards to become 'normal' masked server cards instead.



This will be a ONE WAY street. Once landed, user data will be deleted

on start-up and they won't be able to re-cache the cards locally.



Bug: 1497734

Change-Id: I09ee81bcabedab750521e3ec57eb0ba0646656c5

entry.title: arc: Add method to check if enough samples to detect jank
entry.content:
ArcGraphicsJankDetector::IsEnoughSamplesToDetect can be used as precheck

to verify there is enough samples available to use the detector. This

can prevent going through more expensive operations (e.g. sorting,

iterating through samples, calling OnSample) early if it's not useful.



Other cleanups:

- Minor cleanup in RecordPresentedFrame.

- Log errors when not enough samples were available to detect jank or

if detector is not in the correct state after rate detection.

- Hide kPauseDetectionThreshold since it doesn't need to be public.

- Fix Lint warnings and added more comments.



BUG=b:318720112, b:290846501, b:310010825

TEST=unit_tests --gtest_filter="ArcGraphicsJankDetectorTest*" --gtest_filter="ArcAppPerformanceTracingTest*" --gtest_filter="ArcGraphicsTracingHandlerTest*"

TEST=browser_tests --gtest_filter="AutotestPrivateArcPerformanceTracing*"

entry.title: [DTC] Fix jank caused by incorrect scrim opacity update during tab strip
entry.content:
transition



It has been observed that on occasion, the transition scrim opacity in a

hide->show strip transition uses an incorrect value of 1f in concluding

compositor frame updates during the transition. This may be due to

untimely frame updates initiated by unexpected sources when transition

is in progress.



This CL updates the opacity calculation logic to use the newly

determined opacity value only if it is in congruence with the old value

during transition in a certain direction.



Before:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTA4NDE3NjM0NzgyNDEyOHw5ODJlZjdjNy1jNA

After:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjE4MDMwNzYzNTAxMTU4NHxhODlmZGMwNC1kNg



Bug: b/324130906

entry.title: Improve force-webxr-runtime logic
entry.content:
Improves the force-webxr-runtime logic in several ways:

1) Adds ArCore and Orientation Sensors as options

2) Removes lingering references to GVR

3) Removes some existing logic to not add enabled providers if another

runtime was forced. Enabled runtimes are always added. Disabled runtimes

are added if their runtime is enabled *or* force-webxr-runtime is set to

their runtime.

4) Centralizes Runtime forcing to xr_runtime_manager_impl.



One area of potenital future improvement would be to replace the

"SupportsArBlendMode" with just a "SupportedSessionModes" set, and then

we can have a flat list of items to check and can consolidate some of the

`Get(Mode)Runtime` logic; but that started to spiral into a larger CL

than seemed prudent for this change, and isn't really necessary longer

term.



Fixed: 1524157

Change-Id: I3707cd0fb8295e7baf15f33eb9545d682eeee303

entry.title: Revert "Add feature flag to enable media compression"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9d6939d09bef37a2d65d79013c25185df299f979.



Reason for revert: Remove the dependency on environment variable

|ENABLE_INTEL_MEDIA_COMPRESION| to control minigbm's behavior

to allocate media compressed buffers. The original CL change

includes the introduction of the feature flag

|EnableIntelMediaCompression| and the environment variable.

This reverting CL, however, still keeps the feature flag

around as it does not affect minigbm's allocating behavior.

The change also removes relevant callsites of the variable

in various places, and the dependent CL is the alternative

solution to controlling minigbm's allocation of media

compressed buffers.



Original change's description:

> Add feature flag to enable media compression

>

> From Gen-12 onwards on Intel, minigbm can allocate compressed

> buffers and the functionality landed in CL:4655427. In order

> to safely guard the feature and have all the support

> for compressed buffers in place for chrome, this CL adds

> a feature flag to enable Media compression on Intel.

> This flag, when enabled, sets the environmental variable to

> allow minigbm to allocate media compressed buffers that

> are suitable for use in the hardware video codec pipeline.

> This CL also adds strong assertions at important places

> where |gbm_create_device()| is called to ensure the minigbm

> environment variable is set before potentially initializing

> minigbm.

>

> This CL is a follow-up cleanup to CL:4629410 to ensure

> the environment variable is set up in test environments.

>

> BUG=b:271455200

> TEST=deploy to chrome and check if flag is enabled

>

> Change-Id: I4d1614e04ca2420d32226917a3d368348ceb9db0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4822820

> Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

> Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

> Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

> Commit-Queue: Hang Nguyen

> Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208463}

entry.title: Add Element::AddConsoleMessage
entry.content:
This patch adds a helper method to Element which automatically

constructs a ConsoleMessage and attaches the element to the console

message. This makes it easier to and hopefully increases the likelihood

that people will attach the relevant element to their console messages

more often, which helps developers find out which element the console

message is talking about because then the element shows up in DevTools

next to the message and can be highlighted in the Elements panel.

entry.content:
This test has been disabled for >5 years. I attempted to re-enable it,

but this test is simply too slow to run reliably on the waterfall bots -

it takes nearly 10 seconds to run on a workstation with no other load,

so it's not likely to reliably run on either release or debug bots.



Since it's been disabled for so long, and there's not a realistic

prospect of making it fast enough to run reliably, this change deletes

it.

entry.title: Implement the view controller for virtual card enrollment. 5/X
entry.content:
This change forwards the virtual card ui model from the coordinator to

the mediator. The mediator then converts this autofill C++ type to an

Objective-C before sending it to the consumer, a view controller also in

this change.



This view explains virtual cards, shows the credit card to be enrolled,

shows the legal messages, and designed illustrations. The virtual card

enrollment bottom sheet extends the BottomSheetViewController (a

ConfirmationAlertViewController). Link and button clicks are delegate

back to the Coordinator.

entry.title: Fix the bug that the bubble launcher anchored at the top of VK
entry.content:
The bug is that when opening the bubble launcher with virtual keyboard

visible, the bubble launcher will be anchored at the top of the virtual

keyboard even if it becomes hidden when the launcher is shown. This is

because the virtual keyboard is hidden after the target bounds of

bubble launcher is set.

This cl fixes that by hiding the keyboard when the launcher will

become visible. Note that hiding the keyboard is also done when the

visibility is changed as the focus will move to the search textfield

but we still don't want the virtual keyboard to show.



Bug: b/291716822

entry.title: [EditContext] Null-check GetDocument().FocusedElement() at the original position
entry.content:
The change [1] was an attempt to fix a crash introduced in [2].



However, it introduced another crash (crbug.com/324388729) because

the GetDocument() call that was moved up requires that

IsAvailable() is true (i.e. the InputMethodController has an

ExecutionContext), which is checked further down below.



So, revert [1] and add a null check at the precise spot

necessary to fix the initial crash (crbug.com/323834671) by

no longer dereferencing the pointer so that the pointer override

of IsA is called, which has its own null-check [3].



Note: it seems that an IsAvailable() check is not required in the

scope of GetActiveEditContext() because we can't have an active

EditContext without also having an ExecutionContext.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5274524

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5150014

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/casting.h;l=113;drc=5e4575c404a5571e5997be05352ab16fdf912361



Bug: 324388729, 323834671

Change-Id: Ibab647335087a2cd7321099913a366502680bc36

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5279781

Commit-Queue: Dan Clark

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

Reviewed-by: Anupam Snigdha

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258211}

entry.title: Add remote-cocoa support for context menus.
entry.content:
For now this only enables the remote-cocoa implementation for windows

that are actually out-of-process, although with some slight tweaks the

same implementation would work just fine for in-process menus as well.



For views based context menus, a second MenuRunnerImplInterface

implementation is added, MenuRunnerImplRemoteCocoa; this

implementation serializes the menu model to a series of mojom structs

before passing it all of to the remote NSWindow bridge to display

the menu.



Since picking between MenuRunnerImplCocoa and

MenuRunnerImplRemoteCocoa depends on the views::Widget the menu is

being displayed in (and that widget is not available at construction

time, even though in practice the same MenuRunner is never ran on

multiple widgets) a MenuRunnerImplMac implementation is also added

that delays picking the actual concrete MenuRunnerImplInterface

implementation until RunMenuAt is called.



For web-contents based context menus, some shared logic is moved from

RenderViewContextMenuMacCocoa to RenderViewContextMenuMac, and a new

subclass RenderViewContextMenuMacRemoteCocoa is added. The latter

delegates to MenuRunnerImplRemoteCocoa to actually invoke the menu

(for this purpose MenuRunnerImplRemoteCocoa has a few methods that

aren't part of the MenuRunnerImplInterface abstract class).



To make sure the NSMenu is targeting the correct NSView (for example

for populating the "Services" submenu), a ns_view_id getter is added

to RenderWidgetHostView; this way we can pass a reference to the

correct NSView over mojo to the app shim process.



Finally to reduce code duplication, some of the code shared between

MenuRunnerImplCocoa, RenderViewContextMenuMacCocoa and a newly

added remote_cocoa::ContextMenuRunner, some of the shared code is

moved to a new ui/base/cocoa/menu_utils file.



Include-Ci-Only-Tests: true

Bug: 1488965

Change-Id: I4adde8085041cd62a082c7de4fe8ef6fab93936c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259806

entry.title: updater: Allow arbitrary length for brand string in tag
entry.content:
This clarifies that the length of the brand string in the tag is

arbitrary and not limited to 4 characters in length.

Further normalization of the string value, if needed, can be done on

the server. This avoids updater errors due to trivial configuration

errors of the brand tag.



No code changes are done, this has been the behavior of brand code in

O4 since the beginning.

entry.title: [DTC] Measure control container after toolbar margin updates
entry.content:
** Please do not revert if this caused any CI test failures **



ToolbarControlContainer specified a minimumHeight in its layout, and we didn't update that when DTC is enabled. As a result, when tab strip is hidden, the control container was not resized correctly. This leads to the issue where ToolbarControlContainer#onTouchEvent consumed touches at the top of the content area when Android top control is visible.



This change introduce the fix by changing the minHeight before the transition starts and finishes.



- Before the transition, we update the minHeight one-layout-ahead when we kick-off browser controls height change. Different than changing the top margin of the toolbar, because browser control performs a transitionY at the same message loop as height changes, setMinimumHeight has to be done before hand if order to avoid glitch during the hide -> show transition

- After the transition, set the minHeight for the control container to the size of the tab strip and the toolbar's height and remeasure. This is done in the new layout pass, to make sure the ToolbarProgressBar has updated its top margin accordingly.



Bug: b/324178484

Change-Id: I8a52c6312170b0fb35293e0571411dfc4f70021f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280596

Commit-Queue: Wenyu Fu

Reviewed-by: Aishwarya Rajesh

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

entry.title: Change loading distance threshold to margin
entry.content:
This change aligns the lazy loading frame observer implementation with

the spec language, reduces confusion as threshold has an entirely

different meaning in the context of intersection observer, as a part of

the effort to implement lazy loading for iframes in carousels



Specs:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#lazy-load-root-margin



https://www.w3.org/TR/intersection-observer/#dom-intersectionobserverinit-rootmargin



https://www.w3.org/TR/intersection-observer/#dom-intersectionobserverinit-threshold

entry.title: [Benefits] Shows benefits tag if benefits are available for the card
entry.content:
The payment settings page displays the "Card benefits available

(terms apply)" message for a credit card when benefits are

available and the kAutofillEnableCardBenefits flag is enabled.

'terms apply' is a link that opens the product terms page

in a new tab.

Summary sublabel examples:

Virtual card turned on | Card benefits available (terms apply)

Virtual card turned on | CVC saved | Card benefits available

(terms apply)

11/23 | Card benefits available (terms apply)

11/23 | CVC saved | Card benefits available (terms apply)



Mock:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BT5vfQXvwcLTKLQ.png

After:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BKQYNMnFYfh6Kry.png

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8QdgU5GXu7Jn5nY.png

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6URnrzvdvPup6me.png

Video:

http://screencast/cast/NTU5MTAxNzg1NTEyMzQ1Nnw1ZmFjNGY4Ny1lNw



The virtual card's summary sublabel becomes too long to fit the

available space when displaying both CVC and benefit tags, causing

part of the tags to be hidden. To address this, consulted with

UX team and decided to allow the line to word wrap.



Before:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3rG38ajxyjBXz9o.png

After:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6URnrzvdvPup6me.png

entry.title: [Grid] Fix resolution of alignment properties for subgridded items
entry.content:
There was an issue with the `align-*` and `justify-*` properties and

subgridded items where, if its parent subgrid was orthogonal to the root

grid that considered such item for sizing, then the alignment properties

were incorrectly resolved relative to the root grid's writing mode.



Fixing this behavior making sure that we always resolve the alignment

properties of a grid item relative to its parent grid's writing mode.



Adding test coverage to the WPT suite for this issue.



Bug: 1521978

entry.title: Add a helper tool to copy web app shims to their final destination
entry.content:
When using ad-hoc signing for web app shims, the final app shim must be

written to disk by this helper tool. This separate helper tool exists so

that binary authorization tools, such as Santa, can transitively trust

app shims that it creates without trusting all files written by Chrome.

This allows app shims to be trusted by the binary authorization tool

despite having only ad-hoc code signatures.



Care is taken to ensure that the helper tool is only invoked by a

program signed with the same code signing identity as the Chromium

framework to ensure that the helper tool cannot be used to arbitrarily

bypass binary authorization tools.



Bug: 1465647

Change-Id: I6fc993ca3cf74add2f68ba6e837007ec1ef0e7ba

entry.title: documentScan: Merge duplicate zeroconf and lorgnette responses
entry.content:
Some scanners can be detected by both a lorgnette SANE backend and a

zeroconf response. When this happens, we want to prefer the connection

info from lorgnette because it has already been validated. However, we

want to take the display name and model info from the zeroconf record

because it matches the information shown in the printer settings page.



To consolidate the redundant records, copy the desired zeroconf fields

into the lorgnette response and then mark the zeroconf name as unusable.

This prevents further probing or other use of the zerconf record, but

includes the name in the final response from the lorgnette response.



Bug: b/322325211

entry.title: [Tabs] Change NTP discarding behavior
entry.content:
Change tab discarding behavior for Android to better handle tab groups

behind the AndroidTabGroupStableIds flag.



Added rules:

* NTPs that have one of the new TabGroupIds (indicating they are part of

a tab group) are saved to the tab list metadata file.

* NTPs that have root ID or tab group ID changed (indicating that they

were added or removed from a tab group) are forced to save a TabState

file so that the tab group information is not lost.

entry.title: Send extension CWS requests only if official API key is used
entry.content:
Currently, the CWSInfoService can send extension requests to the

CWS Item Service API endpoint with unconfigured/invalid API keys.

This can result in large number of rejected requests that are

retried unnecessarily. Only allow sending a request if official

Google API key is being used.



Also, remove CWSInfoService::CanFetchInfo as it is no longer

needed.

entry.title: IndexedDB: Collapse WebIDBCursor into IDBCursor
entry.content:
This change collapses WebIDBCursor into IDBCursor. As part of this it

updates references to WebIDBCursor.



Usage and header includes have also been updated. Unnecessary

includes have been removed.



Additionally, the logic in indexed_db_dispatcher.h/.cc has been simplified to a couple static helper methods in IDBCursor. These methods now access ThreadSpecific HeapHashSets of IDBCursors.



Finally, WebIDBCursor specific tests have been updated to use IDBCursor



Bug: 1511023, 41483614

entry.title: desk_profiles: Adding DeskProfilesUsageStatus metric
entry.content:
This will let us track the relative adoption of desk profiles. Whenever

a desk bar is opened, we log a metric in one of three buckets:



1. Conditions for desk profiles are not met - this includes lacros

not being enabled, or there only being a single lacros user etc.

In general this means the user has not been presented with the

option to pick a profile.

2. Conditions to show the desk profile picker have been met, but the

user has not selected a profile for a desk.

3. The user has actively assigned a lacros profile to a desk.



It is primarily the relative sizes of buckets 2 and 3 that is of value.



BUG=b:315167975



Change-Id: Ic58a6213be0bf1ed2a008f456e83cbfb5ac5bf2b
